text: Psalm 142
A Prayer for Deliverance from Pursuers
A maskil of David.
When he was in the cave. A prayer.\f + \fr Ps 142 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
I cry out with my voice to Yahweh;
I implore favor with my voice to Yahweh.
I pour out my complaint before him;
I declare my trouble before him.
When my spirit faints within me,
you know my way.
On the path where I walk,
they have hidden a trap for me;
look to \add my\add* right and see.
There is no one looking out for me;
there is no escape for me;\f + \fr 142:4 \ft Hebrew “a refuge has perished from me” \f*
no one cares for my soul.\f + \fr 142:4 \ft Or “life” \f*
I cry out to you, O Yahweh.
I say, “You \add are\add* my refuge,
my portion in the land of the living.”
Attend to my cry,
for I am brought very low.
Deliver me from my pursuers,
for they are stronger than I.
Bring me\f + \fr 142:7 \ft Hebrew “my soul” \f* out of prison,
that I may give thanks to your name.
\add The\add* righteous will encircle me,
because you will deal bountifully with me.
